intro: Crepis lappacea, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy, often succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators. Crepis lappacea is known for its compact growth form and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
